page.title: 01Ryde
page.content: Ryde is a seaside town on the north east shore of the{Isle of Wight.The {Island}is situated off the south coast of{England}with the nearest mainland towns being{Portsmouth}and{Southampton During the 19th Century it developed as a holiday resort becoming popular when{Queen Victoria}built her holiday home on the Island. The improvement of ferry services made it a popular place for visitors. {Ryde}has a population of 23,000 and is situated on hilly slopes looking down on the sea. Its{pier}which is needed to cross the sands to reach the ferries is the{second{longest in {Britain and is half a mile long.}The pier has pedestrian routes,{train {routes and used to have a tramway {service too.
